Phoebe Murray signs first semi-professional contract. Phoebe a 16 year old midfielder has graduated from the performance school and featured in the Women's first team last season making 24 appearances ((7)

Adele Lindbaek Bayley Hutchison Eilidh Shore Emma Lawson

Keeley Banfield Jennifer Currie (GK) Jessica Broadrick Nadine Hanssen

NEW MANAGER:

Colin Bell

Colin took over the South Korean National Team where he has been leading the team for the last 5 years. He was the first ever manager to guide them to the Asia Cup Final. He also led them to qualification for the 2023 Women's World Cup in Australia.

With the Korea Football Association's agreement he will now take up his role immediately replacing the outgoing boss Clint Lancaster.

AIRDRIE LADIES FC - LEAGUE ONE

Thomas Smith has been appointed as the new Head Coach until summer 2025. Thomas has experience in the game with Glasgow City FC and Strathclyde University.

Maggie Wright Terri Deegan Stacey McCallum

Head Coach Ryan Cooney departs the club *6th May 2024

Aimee Dilworth Amy Horn Alexis Curry Eilidh Weir Kayley Robinson Lauren Watters Ruth Gorman Sophie Douglas

Ruth Gorman and Aimee Dilworth have signed 1 year pre-contracts with Glasgow Women.

GK Erin Rodgers will remain with the club. After suffering a serious injury requiring surgery only 2 games into the season, she will not be signing, but will have their full support while on the road to recovery. We at Jax Mc Media wish Erin a speedy recovery and hope to see her back playing sometime in the not to distant future.

Taylor Shields Jude Shepherd

Kevin Candy joins the team as Head of Performance. Kevin was previously the manager of St Johnstone WFC and brings a wealth of experience with spells in the past at Forfar Farmington WFC, Boroughmuir Thistle and Aberdeen. He holds a UEFA GK B Licence.

Paul Young joins the team as Sports Therapist. Paul has a business in Dalgety Bay having previously worked with a Physio and Chiropractor in Edinburgh. He has experience in sport working with Dunfermline Athletic Rugby Club and more recently with Inverkeithing Hillfield Swifts. He holds an HND in Sports Therapy and Rehabilitation and is working towards his degree.

18s NEXT GEN SQUAD NEWS

With the upcoming changes in the Scottish FA Next Generation age groups ALL but one Under 18 player will now be classed as overage when the age group changes to Under 17s for the start of the new season.

An exit list of players can be provided by the club for those requesting by emailing: accieswfc@gmail.com
